item.title: Sticky Garlic Chicken Noodles: A Cozy Fall Delight
item.description: These sticky garlic chicken noodles are a comforting fall meal. Tossed in a sweet and savory sauce, they come together quickly for busy weeknights. You'll love how easy they are!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 8 oz egg noodles, uncooked
  • 1 lb chicken breast, sliced
  • 3 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp honey
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper
  • 2 green onions, chopped

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
  2. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add sliced chicken and season with black pepper.
  3. Cook the chicken for about 5-7 minutes, or until browned and cooked through.
  4. Add minced garlic, soy sauce, and honey to the skillet. Stir to coat the chicken and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
  5. Toss in the cooked noodles and mix until they are well coated in the sauce.
  6. Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.

item.title: Bright Winter Salad with Oranges and Pecans
item.description: This bright winter salad combines fresh greens, juicy oranges, and crunchy pecans. Itâ€™s a vibrant addition to any holiday table! Perfect for gatherings or just a quick, healthy lunch. Try it and see how easy it is to make!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 0 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 cups mixed greens (like spinach and arugula)
  • 2 medium oranges, peeled and segmented
  • 1/2 cup pecans, roughly chopped
  • 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
  • 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
  • Salt and pepper to taste

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. OK so first, grab a large salad bowl and toss in those mixed greens. You want a good base, you know?
  2. Next, add in the orange segments. Seriously, those juicy bites are what make this salad pop.
  3. Now sprinkle the chopped pecans and crumbled feta on top. The crunch and creaminess? So good!
  4. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Drizzle that over the salad. I said drizzle, but you might wanna pour it on if you're feeling wild.
  5. Finish with a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Toss everything gently, but don't go crazy - you want those oranges to stay pretty.
